Today is my last day with Atlas Informatics - it has been a wild and fascinating journey.  My thanks to all who played a role in our company from Ivy Softworks through to its spin out Atlas.co.  You made the difference - thank you.

Dev9 is hiring!  If you are an experienced Software Engineer (in the Seattle area) with a background in Java and Web Services, please connect with me. Dev9 is launching several new consulting projects where you will be able to gain a deeper experience with the cloud while leveraging your current background. We hire full time and offer opportunities for learning and advancement.  #smallteams #collaborative #craftsmanship

Game Studio One creates multi-platform strategy & simulation video games.Our first titles will be announced in 2017.Titles will initially be available for iOS, Android, Windows, and Mac OS X.As we move in to 2017, we'll be inviting a select group of players to participate in our early access release[s]. Served as technical expert for patent case. Prepared opinions, deposed and assisted with deposition preparation. Case settled shortly before jury trial.Technical expert for litigation between software development team and client.  Deposed.  Settled.

One of two managing owners. Responsible for overall direction of the technical consulting services. Established continuous delivery best practices as both and internal and go-to-market offering. Day-to-day work includes architectural & management support for ongoing projects. Ongoing business development work includes initial meetings, estimation, proposals, and contracts.Grew business from 0 to ~100 employees.

All Star Directories (ASD) is an Internet Marketing and Lead Generation firm focused on the higher and secondary education markets. With apx. $50 million in 2008 sales and 75 employees, ASD uses rich original content designed for search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM) to generate highly qualified leads in a highly cost-effective manner. Led all technical aspects of the conversion from PHP to Java, including the use of Groovy and Grails for the development of the internal tools, and the development of a robust, modern environment using Hibernate, Spring, and MySQL. The Agile processes put in place included the use of Maven for build and dependency management and Hudson for continuous integration, including establishing a strong test-centric and integration development culture. Established Scrum as the basis for iterative development.As part of the hiring process, screened over 200 resumes, performed over 100 phone screens and led over 50 face-to-face interviews, including the use of pairing to quickly build a high quality team of FTEs and contractors.

Laid the framework for all technical aspects of the conversion from PHP to Java, including the use and integration of off-the-shelf content management (OpenCMS), the use of Groovy and Grails for the development of the internal tools, and the development of a robust production environment using Hibernate, Spring, and MySQL. Conducted training and coaching on the use of a blended Scrum/XP Agile process. Set up and established the technical components of an Agile project, including the use of Maven for build and dependency management, Hudson for continuous integration, as well as a variety of test tools.

Will Iverson is a technical genius with the chops to design and deliver finished products (hands at keyboard where needed). In my time working with the team at Dynacron (now Dev9), I observed how every detail is important to Will, and top quality is baked in from day one. I remain inspired by Will's passion for the DevOps role in modern software development: creating the right technology solutions to meet the right business challenges. Will is a master of popular theory that delivers practical solutions quickly. He’s also a Java expert, a committed leader, and 100% passionate about work done right. Next time I need a Java team, I know who I’m going to call.

summary: CEO for Game Studio One.  Game Studio One creates multi-platform strategy & simulation video games.  For more information, see https://GameStudioOne.com.Former co-founder and CTO for Dev9, a Seattle-based technology consulting firm (http://www.dev9.com/).  Author of four books, including "Mac OS X for Java Geeks," "Real World Web Services," "Hibernate: A J2EE Developer's Guide," and "Jakarta Commons."Previously, Enterprise Architect for All Star Directories, an Internet Marketing firm focused on lead generation for schools. Before that, Will served as the General Manager for Radiant Machine, the entertainment group at SolutionsIQ, a Pacific Northwest Consulting and Staffing firm. Prior to taking on the entertainment sector, he served as the Practice Director at SolutionsIQ, where he built the custom software professional services team from apx 35 to 85 developers, SDETs, and project managers.Before moving to Seattle and joining SolutionsIQ in 2004, Will led Cascade Technology Group, a private consulting firm, from 1999 through 2004. Prior to Cascade Technology Group, Will Iverson served as Developer Relations Manager for the VisualCafé team at Symantec and as the Java &  Runtimes Product Manager at Apple Computer.He has spoken at a numerous variety of technical conferences including JavaOne, MacWorld, ComDex, and more on behalf of a variety of companies including Symantec, Apple Computer, Sun Microsystems, and Canal+ Technologies.  He is a frequent speaker at SeaJUG, the Seattle Java Users Group.Specialties: Extensive work with Java, developer tools, developer marketing, SEO/SEM.  Current role involves work around Continuous Delivery process & tool improvements and scaling cloud-based solutions.
name: Will Iverson
title: CEO at Game Studio One
